message.content: What's the best sorting algorithm for nearly-sorted data?

content.thinking: The user is asking about sorting algorithms for nearly-sorted data. Insertion sort is O(n) for nearly sorted data, which makes it ideal. Timsort also handles this well since it detects runs.

content.text: For nearly-sorted data, **insertion sort** is excellent â€” it runs in O(n) time when the data is almost sorted. Python's built-in Timsort also handles this case well since it detects existing sorted runs.
